Description: Fragment of upper part of black figure painted pottery situla. Falcon perched on chequered object (neb-basket) facing right.
Curator's comments: Petrie identified this as a hawk on a Neb-basket (Petrie 1888, p. 62), which is therefore chequered; the motive is related to two common Egyptian hieroglyphic signs. The horn-like incision at the back of the head recalls similar markings on Egyptian falcons. Also illustrated in G. Perrot and C. Chipiez, Histoire de l’Art ix, fig. 190.
Bibliographic references: CVA British Museum 8 / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain 13, British Museum 8 (Pl. GB 604, 14 (and Pl. GB 597, 2)) (Group C5)
Petrie 1888 / Tanis. Part II. Nebesheh (Am) and Defenneh (Tahpanhes) (p. 62, pl. xxvi, 1)
Weber 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus anderen ägyptischen Fundorten (TD 245)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.121, p.122, fig.14a-b, p.123)
